channel.title: Asides on Deuts Log
channel.description: Recent content in Asides on Deuts Log

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01K0A0HQD1P6H7AB2CXA2QVF1Q
item.description:
What’s new on DeutsFLIX

The Unholy Trinity (2025)

Set against the turbulent backdrop of 1870s Montana, in the moments before the execution of Isaac Broadway, he gives his estranged son, Henry, an impossible task: murder the man who framed him for a crime he didn’t commit. Intent on fulfilling his promise, Henry travels to the remote town of Trinity, where an unexpected turn of events traps him in town and leaves him caught between Gabriel Dove, the town’s upstanding new sheriff, and a mysterious figure named St. Christopher.
item.content:encoded:
What’s new on DeutsFLIX

The Unholy Trinity (2025)

Set against the turbulent backdrop of 1870s Montana, in the moments before the execution of Isaac Broadway, he gives his estranged son, Henry, an impossible task: murder the man who framed him for a crime he didn’t commit. Intent on fulfilling his promise, Henry travels to the remote town of Trinity, where an unexpected turn of events traps him in town and leaves him caught between Gabriel Dove, the town’s upstanding new sheriff, and a mysterious figure named St. Christopher.

Genres: Western, Adventure, Crime

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01K0A053C58E0SZ97DJV25Q9E0
item.description: @hongster I use it in several of my VPSs and VMs. Good thing about it compared to Duplicati is metadata is saved together with your backup. It also does incremental backups so you won’t necessarily use up huge backup storage. Finally, it encrypts your backups automatically before it sends to the external repository. I usually use Backblaze as my repository.
item.content:encoded: @hongster I use it in several of my VPSs and VMs. Good thing about it compared to Duplicati is metadata is saved together with your backup. It also does incremental backups so you won’t necessarily use up huge backup storage. Finally, it encrypts your backups automatically before it sends to the external repository. I usually use Backblaze as my repository.

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01K09WM9SG8MDEADKVQ4CDD2AS
item.description:
Tried to make a Facebook Page for DeutsFlix, my personal movie stash for friends.
All I wanted: post to my own Page via API.
What I got: use cases, business portfolio links, locked permissions, and zero “consumer” options.

Facebook isn’t for hobbyists anymore. It’s all ads and enterprise gatekeeping. Moving to the fediverse where personal projects still belong.

#Fediverse #Meta #DeplatformingHobbyists #DeutsFlix #Plex #Automation #n8n
item.content:encoded:
Tried to make a Facebook Page for DeutsFlix, my personal movie stash for friends.
All I wanted: post to my own Page via API.
What I got: use cases, business portfolio links, locked permissions, and zero “consumer” options.

Facebook isn’t for hobbyists anymore. It’s all ads and enterprise gatekeeping. Moving to the fediverse where personal projects still belong.

#Fediverse #Meta #DeplatformingHobbyists #DeutsFlix #Plex #Automation #n8n

item.title: Plex API Documentation
item.description:
Plex API Documentation

All of the API documentation on this site as well as all of the SDKs listed here are fully generated from the main Plex OpenAPI specification here, and I invite anyone in the community to contribute!
item.content:encoded:
Plex API Documentation

item.title: KumaTray - System Tray for Uptime Kuma
item.description:
KumaTray - System Tray for Uptime Kuma

KumaTray - A system tray application for monitoring Uptime Kuma instances
To install or not to install, that is the question.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JZXAEE52SFECHXEQ7DV7SH1S
item.description: #Caddy is supposed to be a simple and lightweight reverse proxy service. Three lines of code and you’re good to go! Not a 3 container stack like #CaddyManager github.com/∞
item.content:encoded: #Caddy is supposed to be a simple and lightweight reverse proxy service. Three lines of code and you’re good to go! Not a 3 container stack like #CaddyManager github.com/∞

item.title: Storyden: A forum for the modern age.
item.description:
Storyden: A forum for the modern age.

Storyden is a platform for building communities. A modern take on oldschool bulletin board forums. Designed to be the community platform for the next era of internet culture.
item.content:encoded:
Storyden: A forum for the modern age.

Storyden is a platform for building communities. A modern take on oldschool bulletin board forums. Designed to be the community platform for the next era of internet culture.

item.title: Yamtrack

They say this is a Trakt alternative. We’ll find out soon!
